title: Krylov complexity of thermal state in early universe
abstract: arXiv:2408.03293v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: In our work, we perform a detailed study of the Krylov complexity of the thermal state across the entire early universe, encompassing the inflation, radiation-dominated period, and matter-dominated period, which is for the single field inflation. We utilize both the closed system's method and open system's method to achieve this goal. To accurately calculate the Krylov complexity, we purified the thermal state, resulting in a pure state with two modes. Our analysis with both methods indicates that the Krylov complexity will increase during inflation, but will saturate at constant values during the radiation-dominated and matter-dominated periods, where the generation of particles via preheating leads to this evolution. Furthermore, our findings reveal that inflation behaves as a strong dissipative system, while the radiation-dominated and matter-dominated periods act as weak dissipative systems. tldr: 该文章通过详细研究早期宇宙各阶段的Krylov复杂性，尤其是单场 inflation期间的 thermal state，揭示了宇宙演化过程中的信息处理能力。利用闭合系统和开放系统的方法，作者发现inflation阶段Krylov复杂性随时间增加，而在辐射主导和物质主导时期达到稳定值，这主要是因为粒子产生现象导致的变化。研究还表明，inflation阶段表现出较强的 dissipative systems特征，而辐射和物质主导时期则呈现为较弱的 dissipative systems特征。
